Text: I registered here on tpb so I could thank you for uploading these. Nothing makes me laugh like 90s X-Force.
katytron, you're welcome LOL. if you have never read it, visit http://www.progressiveboink.com/2012/4/21/2960508/worst-rob-liefeld-drawings  -- it makes me laugh out loud
A CLASSIC! I think that article helped me get in to comics though, weirdly enough. I realised that everyone was just like "we do not speak about the 80s/90s okay".

first: i want to thank you for the great upload.
second: where is the lightning that was added 
using at that time 
advanced computer technology???
i don't see it anywhere!!!!!!!!!

there were good things in both decades, unfortunately for several years the bad things sold a lot more copies than the good!

anyway i posted that link and then found myself wasting another hour going through it again. lol

about the lightning, that's what the white jagged lines in the background of the cover are supposed to be! look at the original cover here: http://image2.milehighcomics.com/istore/images/fullsize/60042367456.100.GIF

it probably isn't important, but this reprint came out 1-2 years after marvel bought malibu comics, in part because they had a computerized coloring process that marvel could use. this seems like an early example of playing around with computer graphic "enhancement" of the original cover art.
